items.title: Space industry trailblazer named Australian of the Year
items.description: Katherine Bennell-Pegg has been named 2026 Australian of the Year for making history as the first Australian to qualify as an astronaut under the nation's space program.

items.title: Moderate Liberals 'rock solid' behind Sussan Ley amid leadership whispers
items.description: While conservatives Angus Taylor and Andrew Hastie canvass support to challenge for the Liberal leadership, moderates say there is no mood for turning on Sussan Ley — meaning a spill would likely result in another divided vote.

items.title: Cathy Freeman 'humbled' as she receives Australia's highest honour
items.description: From champion athletes to those working to help our most vulnerable, the 2026 Australia Day Honours List showcases the very best of the nation.

items.title: 'That's when he's got me': Sole survivor of regional NSW shooting speaks out
items.description: Nineteen-year-old Kaleb Macqueen was working on his car in the quiet NSW outback town of Lake Cargelligo last Thursday when violence erupted.

items.title: As the 'rules-based world order' is threatened old economic ideas are revisited
items.description: In the wake of Trump, the world will now have to revisit the conference that set the "rules-based world order" up.

items.title: Extreme Australia Day heatwave predicted in several states
items.description: Record-breaking temperatures above 40 degrees Celsius will be experienced in several parts of Australia from today.

items.title: What we know about the second fatal federal shooting in Minneapolis
items.description: The death of 37-year-old US citizen Alex Pretti has prompted a fierce political debate and further protests in an already tense city. This is what we know about the situation so far.

items.title: Search for missing 12yo boy at Victorian beach
items.description: Police and the community have mounted a search for 12-year-old Danny, who was last seen swimming at a beach in Venus Bay on Sunday afternoon.

items.title: Predicting the future isn't easy. In 1959 these Adelaidians gave it a shot
items.description: I had been trawling absent-mindedly through the ABC's internal digital archive in a vague search for inspiration and clicked on this file called "Letters to the Unborn" at random.

items.title: English veteran stars as Scorchers cruise to record-extending sixth BBL title
items.description: The Perth Scorchers have easily accounted for a meek Sydney Sixers in the BBL final, cruising to a six-wicket triumph at a raucous Perth Stadium.

items.title: De Minaur demolishes Bublik to storm into quarterfinal date with Alcaraz
items.description: Alex de Minaur obliterates Alexander Bublik in straight sets on Rod Laver Arena, after superstars Aryna Sabalenka and Carlos Alcaraz progressed through to the last eight of the Australian Open.

items.title: Fire threatens homes in Victoria's Otways ahead of possible record heat
items.description: An out-of-control bushfire has threatened communities in Victoria's Otways, as heatwave conditions continue in some parts of the state.

items.title: US snowstorm triggers flight cancellations and power outages
items.description: A monster snowstorm is moving across the US, cancelling thousands of flights, knocking out power and snarling major roadways with ice.

items.title: 'Quitting isn't failure': When to scrap or adjust life goals
items.description: Experts say knowing when to abandon or change your goals may be just as important as persistence.

items.title: History quiz: Do you know where the Beatles played their last show?
items.description: Who was David Letterman's first guest on the Late Night show? Who celebrates Republic Day today?

items.title: 'We build what we want to be': Kevin McCloud on his dream home
items.description: What makes a house a home? Grand Designs' Kevin McCloud and design enthusiast Tim Ross say it's as simple as a building that "puts you in contact with other people".

items.title: Some accept the risk of shark bites. Others quietly wrestle with fear
items.description: As a devoted ocean swimmer, I've learned to accept the risk of exploring an ocean that is not my natural habitat.

items.title: Bull shark tagging, extra drones for NSW beaches after attacks
items.description: NSW coast and Sydney Harbour beachgoers can expect to see more drones in the sky after a $4.2 million investment into the state's shark management program in the wake of four shark attacks, including one fatal.

items.title: Kangaroo causes crash chaos as Jay Vine taken out on final TDU stage
items.description: Jay Vine was taken out by a pair of kangaroos and lost yet another teammate to injury, but was still able to hang on and claim a second career Tour Down Under victory.

items.title: American rock climber reaches top of Taipei 101 skyscraper without ropes
items.description: It took Alex Honnold about 90 minutes to reach the top of the 508-metre-tall building.

items.title: Dingoes involved in death of Canadian backpacker euthanased
items.description: Queensland government officials euthanase six dingoes involved in the death of a Canadian backpacker on K'gari, with more to be put down in the coming days.

items.title: Trump praises UK troops as 'brave' warriors, day after 'front line' slur
items.description: The US President has praised British soldiers, after remarks he made earlier this week about NATO troops in Afghanistan were described as "insulting and appalling" by the UK's Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

items.title: Protests erupt in Minneapolis after second US citizen shot dead by agents
items.description: This is the second fatal shooting involving federal agents this month during a surge in immigration enforcement in the northern US city.

items.title: Last-ditch push to land hospitals deal as states fight back
items.description: The Commonwealth will try to force a deal on hospital funding at a National Cabinet meeting this week, after months of stalled negotiations with angry state leaders, who say the federal government is not contributing its fair share.

items.title: Foo Fighters and Beaconsfield miner reunite at Launceston concert
items.description: Foo Fighters frontman Dave Grohl says it was a "profound moment" when a pair of miners requested the rock band's music to lift their spirits while trapped underground in 2006.
